Description: A unique identifier to identify the specific subscription

Note: For XML, the data is sent in AMSX format

Description: 3 letter IATA Airport code the subscription applies to
The HTTP Post endpoint to call to send the update
Note: Must be a well formed URL for the subscription to be accepted

Description: The maximimum time in hours from "NOW" for the time of operation of flights you want updates for
The minimum time in hours from "NOW" for the time of operation of flights you want updates for
When the system calls the defined endpoint, in can include an authorization header. This defines the name of the header
The value of the authorization to incluse in the call back request

Note: If you only want to receive an update if the estimated time of operation has changed, set changeEstimated to "true". If you want to only recieve updates when estimated time of operation has changed or checkin information has changes, set both changedEstimated and changeResourceCheckIn to "true"

Description: Send updates which include a change in allocated Gate information
Send updates which include a change in allocated Stand information
Send updates which include a change in allocated CheckIn information
Send updates which include a change in allocated Baggage Reclaim information
Send updates which include a change in allocated Estimated time of operation
The DateTime that the subscription is valid until
